The pattern (second-guessing, questioning motives, looking for threats) is still there, yeah, but it's quieter and you're aware of it, which means it has less power. You're not "fixed" in the sense of never feeling anxious or never second-guessing again. You're better in the sense of having tools, awareness, and capacity you didn't have before. The pattern showing up around your friend's invitations instead of work mistakes isn't regression—it's just your brain doing what it knows how to do, but now you've got the skills to notice it and choose whether to believe it. That's the difference.
